smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function reuseOrCreate2dAllocation has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function renderToCanvas has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function setCharAtRowAndColumn has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function nativeStartEncoding has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function withAllocation has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function withAllocationSet has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function flattenedYuvImageBytes is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function renderToCanvas is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function createBitmap is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function getCharacterInfo is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function createBitmap is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function savePhoto is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class ViewImageActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class MainActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class MatrixEffect is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class ViewVideoActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

The function createBitmap appears to be too complex.
The function updateGridColors appears to be too complex.
The function encodeVideo appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'ViewImageActivity' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MainActivity' with '36' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'CameraImageGenerator' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

Class 'VideoReader' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ViewVideoActivity' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function handleOverlayViewTouchEvent is nested too deeply.
Function writeHtml is nested too deeply.
Function threadEntry is nested too deeply.

smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: context.getSystemService(Context.WINDOW_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to WindowManager.
data cannot be safely cast to String.
view cannot be safely cast to ImageView.
view cannot be safely cast to TextView.
view cannot be safely cast to TextView.
audioStream cannot be safely cast to FileOutputStream.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of the class or object.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ViewImageActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ImageListActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ShutterMode.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ImageSize.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ExportType.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnusedImports
smells.description: Unused Imports are dead code and should be removed.

instances.message: The import 'java.io.FileNotFoundException' is unused.
The import 'java.io.FileNotFoundException' is unused.
The import 'android.annotation.TargetApi' is unused.
The import 'android.os.Build' is unused.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (alloc.usage and Allocation.USAGE_IO_INPUT != 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: alloc.usage and Allocation.USAGE_IO_INPUT != 0
Parentheses in (alloc.type.x) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: alloc.type.x
Parentheses in (minEdgeColor shr 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: minEdgeColor shr 16
Parentheses in (minEdgeColor shr 8) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: minEdgeColor shr 8
Parentheses in (minEdgeColor) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: minEdgeColor
Parentheses in (maxEdgeColor shr 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: maxEdgeColor shr 16
Parentheses in (maxEdgeColor shr 8) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: maxEdgeColor shr 8
Parentheses in (maxEdgeColor) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: maxEdgeColor
Parentheses in (color shr 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: color shr 16
Parentheses in (color shr 8) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: color shr 8
Parentheses in (a[0] shl 24) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: a[0] shl 24
Parentheses in (255 shl 24) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 255 shl 24
Parentheses around the lambda ({doShare()}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (now - metadata.timestamp < 10000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: now - metadata.timestamp < 10000
Parentheses in (now - firstCheckTimestamp!! < 10000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: now - firstCheckTimestamp!! < 10000
Parentheses around the lambda ({mapOf("itemId" to it)}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (data as String) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: data as String
Parentheses in (pixBuffer[i] and 0xff0000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pixBuffer[i] and 0xff0000
Parentheses in (pixBuffer[i] and 0x00ff00) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pixBuffer[i] and 0x00ff00
Parentheses in (pixBuffer[i] and 0x0000ff) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: pixBuffer[i] and 0x0000ff
Parentheses around the lambda ({entry -> entry.value.toJson()}) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses around the lambda (
                    {entry -> EffectMetadata.fromJson(entry.value as Map<String, Any>)}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (facing == CameraMetadata.LENS_FACING_FRONT) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: facing == CameraMetadata.LENS_FACING_FRONT
Parentheses in (isFrontFacing && orientation == 90) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: isFrontFacing && orientation == 90
Parentheses in (!isFrontFacing && orientation == 270) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !isFrontFacing && orientation == 270
Parentheses in (isFrontFacing != upsideDown) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: isFrontFacing != upsideDown
Parentheses in (ei / gridSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ei / gridSize
Parentheses in (ei % gridSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ei % gridSize
Parentheses in (gridSize - 1 - ei % gridSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: gridSize - 1 - ei % gridSize
Parentheses in (ei / gridSize) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ei / gridSize
Parentheses around the lambda ({defaultEffectAtIndex(i, rs, prefsFn, context)}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (red shl 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: red shl 16
Parentheses in (colorMode == AsciiColorMode.FIXED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: colorMode == AsciiColorMode.FIXED
Parentheses in (if (s.length > 1) s else "0$s") are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (s.length > 1) s else "0$s"
Parentheses in (color shr 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: color shr 16
Parentheses in (color shr 8) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: color shr 8
Parentheses in (bitmapX + sizeXPixels > gridBitmap.width) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: bitmapX + sizeXPixels > gridBitmap.width
Parentheses in (bitmapY + sizeYPixels > gridBitmap.height) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: bitmapY + sizeYPixels > gridBitmap.height
Parentheses in (if (cameraImage.orientation.portrait) ds.height else ds.width) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (cameraImage.orientation.portrait) ds.height else ds.width
Parentheses in (textWidth / maxWidth) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: textWidth / maxWidth
Parentheses in (textColor shr 16) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: textColor shr 16
Parentheses in (textColor shr 8) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: textColor shr 8
Parentheses in (length > drop.prevLength) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: length > drop.prevLength
Parentheses in (dy == length) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: dy == length
Parentheses in (millisSinceActive.toDouble() / raindropLifetimeMillis) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: millisSinceActive.toDouble() / raindropLifetimeMillis
Parentheses around the lambda ({it.name.endsWith(".json")}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses around the lambda ({it.name.substring(0, it.name.lastIndexOf('.'))}) are unnecessary and can be removed.

Parentheses in (imageFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                videoFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawImageFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawVideoFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawAudioFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                videoFramesArchiveForItemId(itemId).length()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: imageFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                videoFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawImageFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawVideoFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                rawAudioFileForItemId(itemId).length() +
                videoFramesArchiveForItemId(itemId).length()
Parentheses around the lambda ({this.threadEntry(callback)}) are unnecessary and can be removed.
Parentheses in (timestamps.last() - timestamps.first()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: timestamps.last() - timestamps.first()

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class PlanarYuvAllocations defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class TextMetrics defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class Raindrop defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class ProcessedBitmap contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called renderToCanvas
The data class ProcessedBitmap contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called renderBitmap
The data class ProcessedBitmap contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called resizedTo
The data class MediaMetadata contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called withEffectMetadata
The data class MediaMetadata contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called withExportedEffectMetadata
The data class CameraImage contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called width

The data class CameraImage contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called size

smells.name: MayBeConst
smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements
smells.description: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.
